intro: Galinsogea, commonly known as the common ironweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. These plants typically have upright, hairy stems and are characterized by their clusters of small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The leaves are usually alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Galinsogea species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
